what fun quirky little game you are a small child in the turn of the century and everyone is a stacking matroyshka russian doll your job is to do little tasks with the ultimate goal of finding your family and you do that by inserting yourself into other successively bigger people to disguise yourself and its funny and cute and a good puzzle solving time
incredibly charming you can feel the love they put into this

stacking is a very charming game but its not very engaging the gameplay is incredibly simple and while its super easy its nice enough and chill and looks quite good for a game released in 2011 originally on consoles theres a lot to do here too with many scenarios that you can unlock not bad if you just need something easygoing
a charming little puzzle game about child slavery  cutscenes are a little long hints are a bit obvious

great little puzzle game just dont think too hard about the horrors of physically entering another person and manipulating them for your personal gain

if costume quest 12 are the allaround best games among double fines experimental shorts this is the most unique one i have no clue how anyone could even come up with an idea of matryoshka dolls as industrialage workers fighting an evil robber baron but im glad they did and the fact that it works splendidly as a puzzle game is even more impressive do not hesitate to play this little gem its a short and simple but highly memorable experience

in typical double fine style stacking is wonderfully quirky and witty from the dialogue to the charming artwork  i took my time with the game and just enjoyed being there  apparently only 79 of players finish the game what  i ran into what i thought was a bug but was me missing something and the person i contacted for support from double fine was very helpful and friendly even though its an old release from them
recommend  another marvel from double fine  a very original and hilarious puzzle game the humor is very present

a rather easy but super sweet and charming game from a studio that means the world to me i love the steampunk dieselpunk aesthetic the game takes place in it gives the game a retro energy that has really only been felt in games like bioshock infinite you may not be challenged to the most excruciating of levels but you will sure find something to enjoy and chuckle about when it comes to this gem  910  a real stacking good time from beginning to end
h3 achievement hunting rating 45 h3 i like the concept and the puzzles were cute you will need to play through levels multiple times and might need a guide to get all achievements

stacking is a nice simple game that makes for a good time waster despite its few down sides 01 no vice acting 02 a story told through silent movie era stile of cutscene this means that if your not a fast reader you could miss some part of the story 03 the price though it is a fun little game it does not feel worth the amount that it is listed for wait for the price to drop by 70 off as i did these three facts aside the game is indeed fun for what it is

stacking   pros  1the art of the game  2i like the music  3i like the humor of the creator    cons  1i am not into the puzzles        the bottom line    the graphics and music are cool on their own but since i have no desire to do the puzzles i cant recommend iti am not saying the game is bad at all though

a very charming casual puzzle game its simple enough that most people will easily be able to complete the main story in a couple of hours but each puzzle has multiple solutions and you are encouraged to find them theres a lot more depth and content than it seems at first

recommended with strong grossout warning simultaneously stunning and disgusting this game has some great mechanics some incredible artwork and unfortunately so much cringe and crass humor that it might not be worth playing i would only recommend it to those who dont mind coarse and grossout humor the rest might want to give it a miss its a real shame too because the puzzles the acrosticstyle clues and such are marvelous

fun quirky and fun to solve multiple different puzzles in several ways trying to figure out all the possible solutions is quite fun to try and reverse engineer what they want you to do if youve played any other double fine games the same line of humour runs through all of them very enjoyable would recommend
awesome game gotta admire double fines ability to make such original entertaining games definable worth you money and time
like many double fine games this is a weird concept that is more what the hell is happening than wow what a fun time

creative unconventional game concept its all about solving riddles by stacking dolls with special abilities into each other the atmosphere is 1930s lower class silly sometimes almost funny  sadly the riddles dont make to much fun either the solution is immediately obvious or one needs to randomly stack and try dolls until the solution is found
double fine never disappoints they always bring something new to experiment with everyone should play this game clever and fun
